content: सत्त्वं [सतो भावः] (Said to be {%<ab>m.</ab>%} also in the first ten senses) {@--1@} Being, existence, entity. {@--2@} Nature, essence {@--3@} Natural character, inborn disposition. {@--4@} Life, spirit, breath, vitality, principle of vitality; <ls>Ś. 2. 9.</ls> {@--5@} Consciousness, mind, sense. {@--6@} An embryo. {@--7@} Substance, thing, wealth. {@--8@} An elementary substance, such as earth, air, fire &c. {@--9@} A living or sentient being, animal, beast; वन्यान् विनेष्यन्निव दुष्टसत्त्वान् <ls>R. 2. 8</ls>; <ls n="R.">15. 15</ls>; किं नोऽपत्यनिर्विशेषाणि सत्त्वानि विप्रकरोषि <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; <ls>Māl. 9.</ls> {@--10@} An evil spirit, a demon, ghost. {@--11@} Goodness, virtue, excellence. {@--12@} Truth, reality, certainty. {@--13@} Strongth, energy, courage, vigour, power, inherent power, the stuff of which a person is made; क्रियासिद्धिः सत्त्वे भवति महतां नोपकरणे <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>; <ls>R. 5. 31</ls>; <ls>Mu. 3. 22.</ls> {@--14@} Wisdom, good sense. {@--15@} The quality of goodness or purity regarded as the highest of the three Guṇas <ab>q. v.</ab>; (it is said to predominate most in gods and heavenly beings). {@--16@} A natural property or quality, characteristic. {@--17@} A noun, substantive.
